availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Steele (Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and curator of Kentucky Univ)

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, farmer and university curator. Son of John Steele and Jane Patterson Steele. Married to Sallie Steele. Father of Samuel Steele, Jennie Steele, Maria Steele, William Steele, John Steele, Elizabeth “Lizzie” Steele, Richard Steele, Patterson Steele, and Andrew Steele. Farmer in Fayette County in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Farmer in Fayette County in 1860. Member of the board of curators of Kentucky University.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Precinct 4, p. 81B.
